problem.p: The following series of questions refer to the “modified” Atwood machine, as shown in the diagram. (As usual, we assume ideal strings and pulleys.)

Finding the general solutions for the accelerations of the blocks and the tensions in the strings is surprisingly difficult (compared to the two-block Atwood machine) and algebraically tedious. However, you are not expected to find the general solution in order to answer the questions below.
What is the relationship between the accelerations of the blocks a1, a2 and a3? (Accelerations are assumed to be positive if they are directed downward.)
